steps.title: The Traditional Path
steps.narration: In the old world, career progression was slow. Most juniors spent 3 to 5 years before being considered mid-level, and another 2 to 5 years to reach senior. That's potentially a decade of waiting!

steps.title: The AI Revolution
steps.narration: But the rules have changed. AI tools like Cursor, Claude, and GitHub Copilot are force multipliers. They don't replace engineers‚Äîthey amplify what engineers can do.

steps.title: Learn 10x Faster
steps.narration: AI explains code, patterns, and concepts on demand. Instead of spending hours searching documentation, you get instant, contextual explanations tailored to your exact code.

steps.title: Build 5x More
steps.narration: Ship features at a pace that impresses senior engineers. AI handles the boilerplate so you can focus on the interesting architecture and business logic problems.

steps.title: The New Timeline
steps.narration: With AI augmentation, junior to mid-level takes 6 to 12 months. Mid to senior takes another 12 to 18 months. That's 18 to 24 months total‚Äînot 8 to 10 years!

steps.title: Work Differently, Not Harder
steps.narration: The difference between a 10-year journey and a 2-year journey isn't about working harder. It's about working differently. Let's explore the four principles that separate accelerators from the pack.

steps.title: Think Like an Architect
steps.narration: Stop just completing tasks. Understand systems. See patterns across codebases. Design before you build. Ask 'why are we building this?' before asking 'how do I implement this?'

steps.title: Use AI Strategically
steps.narration: AI isn't just for code generation. Use it for explanations on demand, code review assistance, and exploring alternative approaches. Make AI your 24/7 senior mentor.

steps.title: Build Visible Impact
steps.narration: Ship features. Fix production bugs. Document systems that confuse others. Your work should be visible to your team and leadership. Impact that nobody sees doesn't advance your career.

steps.title: Learn Deliberately
steps.narration: Read senior engineers' code. Ask 'why' not just 'how.' Seek feedback actively. Every PR review is a free lesson from someone more experienced. Don't just fix the comment‚Äîunderstand it.

steps.title: The Accelerator Mindset
steps.narration: Combine all four principles and you become an accelerator. You're not just completing tickets‚Äîyou're growing into a senior engineer at 5x the traditional pace.

steps.title: Junior Code: It Works
steps.narration: Junior code typically works, but it's fragile. No type hints. No documentation. Maybe some SQL injection vulnerabilities. It solves the immediate problem but creates future problems.

steps.title: Add Type Hints
steps.narration: Type hints tell other developers‚Äîand your IDE‚Äîexactly what your function expects and returns. They catch bugs before runtime and make code self-documenting.

steps.title: Add Documentation
steps.narration: Docstrings explain the why, not just the what. What does this function do? What are the edge cases? What errors might it raise? Future you will thank present you.

steps.title: Add Input Validation
steps.narration: Never trust input. Validate parameters. Use parameterized queries to prevent SQL injection. Raise meaningful errors for invalid inputs. Defense in depth.

steps.title: Senior Code: Production Ready
steps.narration: The result is production-ready code. It's secure, maintainable, and self-documenting. And here's the secret: you can ask AI to transform junior code into senior code instantly!

questions.question: How long does the traditional path from junior to senior typically take?
questions.explanation: The traditional path takes 5-10 years: 3-5 years to mid-level, then another 2-5 years to senior. AI-augmented development can compress this to 18-24 months.

questions.question: What role do AI tools play in career acceleration?
options: They're force multipliers that amplify what engineers can do
They're only useful for senior engineers
They slow down learning by doing the work for you
questions.explanation: AI tools are force multipliers‚Äîthey don't replace engineers, they amplify capabilities. You learn faster, build more, and focus on higher-level problems.

questions.question: What's the accelerated timeline from junior to senior with AI augmentation?
questions.explanation: With AI augmentation: 6-12 months to mid-level, then 12-18 more months to senior. Total: 18-24 months‚Äîroughly 5x faster than traditional paths.

questions.question: What's the MOST important behavior change for accelerating from junior to senior?
options: Thinking about systems and asking 'why' before 'how'
questions.explanation: Systems thinking is the key differentiator. AI can write code fast, but senior engineers provide the 'why'‚Äîunderstanding context, trade-offs, and long-term implications.

questions.question: Which of these is NOT one of the four acceleration principles?
questions.explanation: The four principles are: Think like an architect, Use AI strategically, Build visible impact, and Learn deliberately. Working harder isn't the answer‚Äîworking differently is.

questions.question: Why is 'visible impact' important for career acceleration?
options: Impact that nobody sees doesn't advance your career
Visibility is more important than quality
It helps you avoid difficult tasks
questions.explanation: You can do amazing work, but if leadership doesn't see it, it won't advance your career. Ship features, fix production bugs, document systems‚Äîmake your contributions visible.

questions.question: What's the main problem with 'junior code that works'?
options: It solves the immediate problem but creates future problems
questions.explanation: Junior code often works but is fragile‚Äîno types, no docs, potential security issues. It solves today's problem while creating tomorrow's tech debt.

questions.question: Why are type hints valuable in production code?
options: They catch bugs before runtime and make code self-documenting
questions.explanation: Type hints help IDEs catch bugs before you run the code, serve as documentation, and make refactoring safer. They're not required but are a senior-level practice.

questions.question: How can AI help you write production-quality code?
options: AI can't help with code quality
Ask it to transform junior code into senior code with types, docs, and validation
You shouldn't use AI for production code
questions.explanation: AI is excellent at transforming code! Ask Cursor to add type hints, docstrings, and error handling‚Äîit can convert fragile code to production-ready code in seconds.
